description: Set of tools facilitating the analysis and editing of protein side chain conformations. Using a PDB file as input, the tools allow the user to perform such tasks as listing and/or modifying the values of the dihedral angles, listing structurally compatible rotamers for each residue and substituting side chains resulting in a new structure.
name: SCit

metadata.abstract: SCit is a web server providing services for protein side chain conformation analysis and side chain positioning. Specific services use the dependence of the side chain conformations on the local backbone conformation, which is described using a structural alphabet that describes the conformation of fragments of four-residue length in a limited library of structural prototypes. Based on this concept, SCit uses sets of rotameric conformations dependent on the local backbone conformation of each protein for side chain positioning and the identification of side chains with unlikely conformations. The SCit web server is accessible at http://bioserv.rpbs.jussieu.fr/SCit. © Oxford University Press 2004; all rights reserved.
metadata.title: SCit: Web tools for protein side chain conformation analysis
